website_summaries.verdict: Good ones are immensely powerful, flexible and well-balanced.
pros: Based on a well-proved Husqvarna design
High-performance engine makes for effective weed eating and brush cutting

customer_reviews.title: Starts easy has a TON of power!
customer_reviews.text: I love this trimmer it starts on the first or second pull and has a ton of power. It also accepts universal attachments. Great product at a great price I highly recommend this product to anyone who wants more power than one of those cheap home center units. Plus it comes with a 2 year warranty. Cant beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Deane

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, buy a good harness and a good blade.
customer_reviews.text: Runs perfect, starts easy. I recommend a better harness. And the Forrester blade with chainsaw teeth. This thing will take out trees up to 4” diameter. It’s a beast!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: For the money, it’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: For the money this does an okay job cutting brush. I really hate how hard it is to start (takes about 20 - 25 pulls) even when following the starting instructions. I also don’t like that it only runs with the choke open (according to the instructions this is how it has to run). This unit is also very heavy, and the harness leaves a lot to be desired. If there were an alternative option for only a few bucks more I would have bought it. But name brand brush cutters are about $800 minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Power at a bargain price
customer_reviews.text: After getting professional help with assembly, (my first experience with nylon bushings), it's a very powerful brush cutter. Important note: The pro who helped assemble was able to get the choke switch to work after a metal part in the way was resituated with washers providing more space. (In other words, it's worth it to get professional help if you don't have lots of experience with stuff like this. He congratulated me on buying such a beast!)
customer_reviews.author: T C Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: after spending 20 minutes getting it started, went to do the edging and looked behind me and the tank was leaking fuel all over the yard. and yes, I had the cap on tight. Just a cheap product that was a mistake buying. Sent it back and bought a Sthil. Starts the second pull and the gas stays in the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Back breaker
customer_reviews.text: There are a good amount of higher ratings and not sure which model they got or if theres is different than the BC152 I have, but this thing is like carrying around 3 bags of cement around the yard and trying to weed eat. What do I mean exactly? IT'S FREAKING HEAVY!!! Painfully so, my back was a wreck by the time I finished my yard. Handles are totally awkward and length is wrong, the side with controls is angled the wrong way and awkward. I would say ignore the positive reviews here if you are not a body builder with arms that can adjust in length.
customer_reviews.author: Coop P

customer_reviews.title: Broken Out Of The Box
customer_reviews.text: This unit was broken out of the box and there was no shipping damage to the box. The starter cord cover is made of plastic and at least 2 of the 4 bolt holes (bottom side) that hold this unit to the engine were busted. This resulted in the first pull of the starter cord disengaging the cord from the starter. Other than that, balance was okay, but I would say that the "handlebars" are a little wide for a shorter person with a shorter arm span (I'm 5'6" tall), as I found it somewhat uncomfortable to hold. Thank heavens for awesome Amazon customer service, as the unit was returned and I received a prompt, full refund.
customer_reviews.author: TheFix

customer_reviews.title: A lot of power for a low price!
customer_reviews.text: A lot of power and quality for a low price. I’ve used it for a month now on a couple gnarly acres of fence line and had no issues. The autofeed head sucks, but I think they all do. I replaced it immediately with a cast single string head. The motor starts easily every time, and runs steady even through extensive high rpm work on the hottest days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good brush cutter
customer_reviews.text: Heavy as heck and overkill for typical grass line trimming, but excellent for brush cutting. The brush cutting blade that comes with it isn't great--buy a chainsaw type circular blade and it'll hack through saplings, limbs and vines. If that's your primary purpose, this is a good pick. Star spline connector--if you have the more common square spline attachments, they won't hook-up. Spring for a better harness. It's pretty much a Stihl knock-off for guys who can't afford a Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: mark leonard

customer_reviews.title: You will want a good harness for this beast
customer_reviews.text: I probably would have given this 5 stars, but the shoulder strap in this box was incomplete. Looking at the pictures, it was missing the shoulder pad and had no way to connect it over your shoulder. I would have ordered a better harness anyway after realizing how heavy it is. Not a problem if you have heavy duty work to do. Ive only used the brush cutting blade so far and it works great. The engine started on the second pull even with gas I bought last year. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Allen P

customer_reviews.title: Runs well, but leaking fuel on first use
customer_reviews.text: On first use, I found that it was leaking fuel. Found a tiny crack in the fuel tank. I'm a bit disappionted that it arrived damaged, I probably should have requested a return, but instead I have epoxied the hole and used it for a couple of hours. I found it easy to start, plenty of power. I have not used the string trimmer head, only the brush blade as that is why I bought it. I'd have given more stars had it not soaked me with fuel. I think I have stopped the leak, I am hoping it continues to work well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty heavy.  You’ll need to get a different harness.
customer_reviews.text: So, one thing you’re going to need to know is that this beast is heavy. Really heavy. The harness is worthless, so I would suggest buying a different one when you order it. Starts up a little finicky until you get its idiosyncrasies, but easy after that. I noticed the price went up significantly after I ordered it. At $149.00 it was a good bargain.
customer_reviews.author: James Ringdal

customer_reviews.title: Totally impressed
customer_reviews.text: Got to say this Brush cutter/weed eater is excellent on every category. easy to start and use on all aspects. The power is readily available, no extra vibration at all. The only issue is the Harness for the quality the Trimmer the Harness falls short on every front. I had to purchase a different harness due to the uselessness of the harness provided.
customer_reviews.author: BURNS B

customer_reviews.title: Strong, well built,
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. It is well built and cuts very well, I put a 7 1/4 carbide tipped, 24 teeth blade on it and I can cut trees and tree limbs with it. Good value for $$$. IT is Made in JAPAN,. not China. I have advised every body I know to BUY This Deal, NOW. TEM
customer_reviews.author: T. E.  M.

customer_reviews.title: lots of power
customer_reviews.text: I need to clear some paths through a wooded area so thick that it's nearly impassable. So far, I have only done a warm-up session, on some brush and trees. Using just the brush blade that came with it, I was able to tear through everything in the way, including, to my amazement, a 5" pine tree which took only a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Adventure

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Assembly instructions are weak but it's not all that difficult, so I didn't have any real problem getting it together EXCEPT the strap is nearly impossible to figure out and NO instructions or diagram for it . Started pretty easily. Seems to have a ton of power.
customer_reviews.author: K Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Big and heavy, so far
customer_reviews.text: Will edit it needed. Unused so far,awaiting harness and forest blade. This thing is heavy.....this thing is more than 6ft long. I must not have read well enough as this monstrosity is long and heavy enough to power a 15ft skiff
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but a good value
customer_reviews.text: Heavy but well worth the money A clone of the older orange&white commercial unit. The harness is not great, tie the shoulder straps together . Easily cut 1” hardwood saplings with the metal blade.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Osgood

customer_reviews.title: Really not happy
customer_reviews.text: This things won’t even cut something is wrong and there is no way to contact seller even with attachment off it doesn’t spin right and they can’t even attach a response email
customer_reviews.author: Eric Beatty

customer_reviews.title: Easy to control with the right harness.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this grass trimmer for better comfort since I have an acre of land. The trimmer starts easily and is not as loud as my old trimmer. The only thing is the shoulder harness was not very supportive, had to purchase one from Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Poor engineering in the bicycle handle bars. Un usable.
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to install bike handle to a usable position. I returned the Brush Cutter before I could try it because of the handle position
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN

customer_reviews.title: Words on choke sticker (BACKWARDS!)
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of land and trails. Lots of sapplings all different sizes and thorn bushes. This thing is getting the job done. It's heavy but it works. You'll need a better harness. One small complaint I do have to have the choke on just a pinch. Or so I thought. The words on and off are backwards on the choke sticker!!!
customer_reviews.author: boo.boom

customer_reviews.title: This machine is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money! Very powerful in heavy undergrowth and light brush. Starts easy if instructions are followed.
customer_reviews.author: Manzanita

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job... Once you get it started.
customer_reviews.text: I had a heck of a time getting it started the first several times I used it. I finally have it figured out - mine won't run with the choke either all the way open or closed (but it's designed to be open or closed). I have to try to get it to stick in the middle, but once I do it runs great! You'll need to buy a new harness, the one that it comes with is TERRIBLE! (I read that on other reviews and figured it was an exaggeration... it wasn't.)
customer_reviews.author: Edward Link

customer_reviews.title: runs well
customer_reviews.text: does run well string not so good will switch to blade
customer_reviews.author: larry hatcher

customer_reviews.title: Get another harness
customer_reviews.text: So far not so bad but I have used only twice. The harness is horrible so get a good one. Started up per instructions. 3rd attempt to start took a bit more but this far pretty good machine
customer_reviews.author: PapaP

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: worked great but is heavy and the shoulder straps not very good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Directions pretty useless for BCI 52 cutter.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently installing the nylon cutter head directly to the cutter after removing the nuts and flanges was a mistake. Am unable to remove the nylon cutter to install properly. Customer service number is a continuous loop with no humans. Perhaps this review will attract a helpful response. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: What a beast
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome what a beast cutting through brush and saplings Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: until I get to try it out and see just how good this cutter is
customer_reviews.text: The delivery truck found all the missing parts, box had a hole in it. So I'm upgrading my last entry, until I get to try it out and see just how good this cutter is.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction and plenty of power. I even cut a 6” tree down with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: cuts through thick brush easily. The handles are solid and make it easy ...
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful, cuts through thick brush easily. The handles are solid and make it easy to use. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: CLTiger

customer_reviews.title: Good except harness
customer_reviews.text: I have had it a few tanks of gas, works quite well.......except harness, it is not good. I ordered a good one today. Other than strap happy with it so far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well designed quality product
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased... incredible power and lots of adjustment options on handles to fit each user, and not that heavy!
customer_reviews.author: Neal Kellner

customer_reviews.title: Brush cutter
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to use. I would recommend this weed eater.
customer_reviews.author: Judy S.

customer_reviews.text: No dis like haven't had any problems from this product since I received it
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: Good weed eater line feeder cheap
customer_reviews.text: The line feeder cracked have not used since great weed eater line feeder is cheap
customer_reviews.author: DIETER SCHMITZ

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Very light and good maneuverability, for this product it’s a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Edilberto Bondoc

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a huge mistake, since it failed after used it twice.
customer_reviews.author: lieneke janssen

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet
customer_reviews.text: This thing runs great and at 5000' elevation. I was super impressed by the quality, nothing on this machine feels cheap or out of place. First pull start ups. runs every time. even if it stopped working I would buy another one. Little on the heavy side but cant complain about that it is a 52cc motor or something close to that. best value!
customer_reviews.author: Mons

product_meta.title: Sunseeker BCI52 2-in-1 Straight Shaft Grass Trimmer and Brush Cutter
product_meta.description: The Sunseeker BCI52 2-in-1 Straight Shaft Grass Trimmer and Brush Cutter is a versatile, powerful tool. The BCI52 has a grass trimmer attachment for detail work along borders and a brush cutter blade to shape up hedges. It also includes a harness coupled with ergonomic bicycle-style handles to relieve the strain on your arms and provide stability. Powered by a 52-cc, 2-cycle, full-crankshaft engine, your BCI52 has plenty of power and is designed for reliability. The full crankshaft design provides a smooth start and operation to reduce emissions, increase fuel efficiency and provide longer life. The transmission is supported by an aluminum casing which greatly reduces vibration allowing you to work in comfort until the job is done. The straight shaft is built with a robust aluminum tube which is lightweight and durable for added comfort and convenience. The tap and go trimmer head allows for quick line feed for the twin line cutting system. Replacing the line will no longer eat up precious daylight and will give you more time to get your lawns and landscaping looking clean. All Sunseeker Gas units come with a 2-Year Manufacturer’s Defect Warranty.
feature_bullets: RELIABLE, QUICK STARTING, AND COMFORTABLE - 52cc 2-cycle, full crankshaft engine designed for quick starts and comfortable operation
YARDWORK MADE COMFORTABLE - Ergonomic bicycle-style handles improve control and stability
2 JOBS IN 1 TOOL - Do two jobs with one tool with included string trimmer spool and brush cutter blade
GET MORE DONE IN COMFORT - Aluminum supported transmission reduces vibration and increases comfort
EASY TO USE AND TOUGH ENOUGH FOR DIFFICULT YARD JOBS - Straight aluminum shaft for increased durability and ease of use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars83 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
